description: Shows school locations, nos., and district boundaries. In title area: Date 9/29/60. Title in india ink on rubber-stamped sheet affixed at lower right. Printed at head of title: Office of the President, Borough of Manhattan. From the papers of Kenneth B. Clark in LC Manuscript Division. Oriented with north toward the upper right. Red and india inks, red and blue pencils, and lead pencil on black-and-white printed street base map. Direction arrow and small correction areas printed on cut-out slips affixed to recto. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Copy brittle, torn, fold-lined, missing small sections, taped, and stained.

description: This record covers single general maps of Alaska, which are not represented in the LC database by separate catalog records. This collection includes single printed maps and photocopies of printed or manuscript single maps as well as some multi-sheet single maps, plates from atlases, books or periodicals, and printed facsimiles. To request a specific map or for more information, contact a reference librarian in the Geography & Map Division (202) 707-6277 or through the "Ask a librarian" link through the Geography & Map Division website https://www.loc.gov/rr/geogmap/. Title supplied by cataloger. Most maps earlier than 1841 in this collection are photocopies. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Most maps in English. Some maps in French, German or Russian. Drawers 1-10

medium: 10 drawers of maps : some color, some hand colored, some photocopies ; various sizes.
notes: This record covers single general maps of Alaska, which are not represented in the LC database by separate catalog records. This collection includes single printed maps and photocopies of printed or manuscript single maps as well as some multi-sheet single maps, plates from atlases, books or periodicals, and printed facsimiles. To request a specific map or for more information, contact a reference librarian in the Geography & Map Division (202) 707-6277 or through the "Ask a librarian" link through the Geography & Map Division website https://www.loc.gov/rr/geogmap/.
Most maps earlier than 1841 in this collection are photocopies.

Most maps in English. Some maps in French, German or Russian.

description: This record covers single maps of Hawaii as a whole covering various subjects, which are not represented in the LC database by separate catalog records. This collection includes single printed maps and photocopies of printed or manuscript single maps and may also include some multi-sheet single maps, plates from atlases, books or periodicals, and printed facsimiles. These maps show various subjects, such as topography and other physical characteristics, public lands and land use, mines and minerals, geology, hydrology, administrative and political divisions, and recreation and tourism. To request a specific map or for more information, contact a reference librarian in the Geography & Map Division (202) 707-6277 or through the "Ask a librarian" link through the Geography & Map Division website https://www.loc.gov/rr/geogmap/. Title supplied by cataloger. Maps and the folders in which they are stored are both displayed in the digital images. The information on the folders is incomplete and may not reflect current research. When the map may be within copyright, only the folder is displayed digitally. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Drawers 4-8, 10.

medium: 6 drawers of maps : some color, some photocopies ; various sizes.
notes: This record covers single maps of Hawaii as a whole covering various subjects, which are not represented in the LC database by separate catalog records. This collection includes single printed maps and photocopies of printed or manuscript single maps and may also include some multi-sheet single maps, plates from atlases, books or periodicals, and printed facsimiles. These maps show various subjects, such as topography and other physical characteristics, public lands and land use, mines and minerals, geology, hydrology, administrative and political divisions, and recreation and tourism. To request a specific map or for more information, contact a reference librarian in the Geography & Map Division (202) 707-6277 or through the "Ask a librarian" link through the Geography & Map Division website https://www.loc.gov/rr/geogmap/.

Maps and the folders in which they are stored are both displayed in the digital images. The information on the folders is incomplete and may not reflect current research. When the map may be within copyright, only the folder is displayed digitally.
Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image.
